page.title: 18HORSINGTON HOUSE HOTEL
page.content: Horsington House was the home of the Doddington family certainly from the late 17th century until they left in 1922. It was probably rebuilt in about 1840, after a disasterous fire,in a Georgian style by Nikolaus Peusner as"High Victorian Italianate".The oak staircase was saved and now forms the central feature of the hotel foyer. Since 1922 Horsington House has been variously used by the Pioneer Corps,the U.S. airforce and from 1946 until 1972 it was Dr.Barnardo's Home. Since being converted into a hotel there have been several owners and Tatlerworth Limited,a small privately owned country house hotel group have been in occupation since July,1981. 1620 saw the first house on this site.
